channel.title: [PI] Object Identifier
channel.description: Hello guys, I have a room I'm looking to clean out, so I could move some npc's in there. Now, It's hard to find some of the object id's for the stuff in here, I was wondering if there's anyway to add an object Identifier. Something like ; " right-clicking on the object would show the object id "... Possibly similar to "NPC IDENTIFIER" I've heard about it, just never done it myself. Here's the room i'm looking to clean out " http://prntscr.com/769d10 " (InsidiaX Source) As usual, any and every help is greatly appreciated. Thank you.

item.title: [PI] Object Identifier
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Two issues with that.

  1. Not all objects have actions.
  2. There are different object types.

So, in short. Yes, you can do it. Generally everything is “possible” in code, but how complex it is varies.

It would be done almost exactly like how you do it with the npcs… But instead of an npc, it’s an object (Class46 non-renamed).

I’m sure you could even edit it to print out the ids of objects that don’t have actions if you wanted, but it’d take more work.

Also, it’s probably in build3dScreenMenu()

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Object Identifier
item.dc:creator: @malimt malimt
item.description:
@malimt wrote:

Hello guys, I have a room I’m looking to clean out, so I could move some npc’s in there.
Now, It’s hard to find some of the object id’s for the stuff in here, I was wondering if there’s anyway to add an object Identifier.
Something like ; " right-clicking on the object would show the object id "… Possibly similar to “NPC IDENTIFIER” I’ve heard about it, just never done it myself.
Here’s the room i’m looking to clean out " http://prntscr.com/769d10 "
(InsidiaX Source)
As usual, any and every help is greatly appreciated.
Thank you.

Read full topic
